006
007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a torus.
016<p>
017   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torus" target="_top">
018                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torus</a>
019<p>
020   This torus is the surface of revolution generated by revolving
021   the circle in the xy-plane with radius {@code r2} and center
022   {@code (r1,0,0)} around the y-axis. We are assuming that {@code r1 > r2}.
023<p>
024   Here are parametric equations for the circle in the xy-plane with
025   radius {@code r2} and center {@code (r1,0,0)} and parameterized
026   starting from the top, with parameter {@code 0 <= phi <= 2*PI}.
027   <pre>{@code
028      x(phi) = r1 + r2 * sin(phi)
029      y(phi) =      r2 * cos(phi)
030      z(phi) = 0
031   }</pre>
032   Here is the 3D rotation matrix that rotates around the y-axis
033   by {@code theta} radians with {@code 0 <= theta <= 2*PI}.
034   <pre>{@code
035      [ cos(theta)   0   sin(theta)]
036      [     0        1       0     ]
037      [-sin(theta)   0   cos(theta)]
038   }</pre>
039   If we multiply the rotation matrix with the circle parameterization,
040   we get a parameterization of the torus.
041   <pre>{@code
042      [ cos(theta)   0   sin(theta)]   [r1 + r2 * sin(phi)]
043      [     0        1       0     ] * [     r2 * cos(phi)]
044      [-sin(theta)   0   cos(theta)]   [        0         ]
045
046      = ( r1*cos(theta) + r2*cos(theta)*sin(phi).
047          r2*cos(phi),
048         -r1*sin(theta) - r2*sin(theta)*sin(phi) )
049
050      = ( (r1 + r2*sin(phi)) * cos(theta),
051                r2*cos(phi),
052         -(r1 + r2*sin(phi)) * sin(theta) )
053   }</pre>
054   See
055     <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torus#Geometry" target="_top">
056              http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torus#Geometry</a>
057
058   @see TorusSector
059*/
060public class Torus extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
061{
062   public final double r1;
063   public final double r2;
064   public final int n;
065   public final int k;
066   public final MeshType type;
067
068   /**
069      Create a torus with a circle of revolution with radius 3/4
070      and a cross section circle (circle of longitude)
071      with radius 1/4.
072   */
073   public Torus( )
074   {
075      this(0.75, 0.25, 12, 16);
076   }
077
078
079   /**
080      Create a torus with a circle of revolution with radius {@code r1}
081      and a cross section circle (circle of longitude) with radius
082      {@code r2}.
083
084      @param r1  radius of the circle of revolution
085      @param r2  radius of the cross section circle (circle of longitude)
086   */
087   public Torus(final double r1, final double r2)
088   {
089      this(r1, r2, 12, 16);
090   }
091
092
093   /**
094      Create a torus with a circle of revolution with radius {@code r1}
095      and a cross section circle (circle of longitude) with radius
096      {@code r2}.
097   <p>
098      The last two parameters determine the number of circles of
099      longitude and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
100   <p>
101      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude, then each circle
102      of longitude will have {@code n} line segments.
103      If there are {@code k} circles of longitude, then each circle
104      of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
105   <p>
106      There must be at least three circles of longitude and at least
107      three circles of latitude.
108
109      @param r1  radius of the circle of revolution
110      @param r2  radius of the cross section circle (circle of longitude)
111      @param n   number of circles of latitude
112      @param k   number of circles of longitude
113      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 3
114      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
115   */
116   public Torus(final double r1, final double r2,
117                final int n, final int k)
118   {
119      this(r1, r2, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
120   }
121
122
123   /**
124      Create a torus with a circle of revolution with radius {@code r1}
125      and a cross section circle (circle of longitude) with radius
126      {@code r2}.
127   <p>
128      The last two parameters determine the number of circles of
129      longitude and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
130   <p>
131      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude, then each circle
132      of longitude will have {@code n} line segments.
133      If there are {@code k} circles of longitude, then each circle
134      of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
135   <p>
136      There must be at least three circles of longitude and at least
137      three circles of latitude.
138
139      @param r1  radius of the circle of revolution
140      @param r2  radius of the cross section circle (circle of longitude)
141      @param n   number of circles of latitude
142      @param k   number of circles of longitude
143      @param type  choose between striped and checkerboard triangle strips
144      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 3
145      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 3
146   */
147   public Torus(final double r1, final double r2,
148                final int n, final int k,
149                final MeshType type)
150   {
151      super(String.format("Torus(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)", r1, r2, n, k));
152
153      if (n < 3)
154         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 2");
155      if (k < 3)
156         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 2");
157
158      this.r1 = r1;
159      this.r2 = r2;
160      this.n = n;
161      this.k = k;
162      this.type = type;
163
164      // Create the torus's geometry.
165
166      final double deltaPhi   = (2 * Math.PI) / n,
167                   deltaTheta = (2 * Math.PI) / k;
168
169      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
170      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n+1][k+1];
171
172      // Create all the vertices.
173      for (int j = 0; j <= k; ++j) // choose a rotation around the y-axis
174      {
175         final double c1 = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
176                      s1 = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
177         for (int i = 0; i <= n; ++i)  // go around a cross section circle
178         {
179            final double c2 = Math.cos(i * deltaPhi),
180                         s2 = Math.sin(i * deltaPhi);
181            v[i][j] = new Vertex( (r1 + r2*s2) * c1,
182                                        r2*c2,
183                                 -(r1 + r2*s2) * s1 );
184         }
185      }
186
187      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
188      for (int i = 0; i <= n; ++i)
189      {
190         for (int j = 0; j <= k; ++j)
191         {
192            addVertex( v[i][j] );
193         }
194      }
195
196      // Create all the triangle strips.
197      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
198      {
199         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
200         {
201            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
202            for (int j = 0; j < k + 1; ++j)
203            {
204               triStrip.addIndex(   i *(k+1) + j);  // v[i  ][j]
205               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)*(k+1) + j);  // v[i+1][j]
206            }
207            triStrip.addIndex(   i *(k+1) + 0);  // v[i  ][0]
208            triStrip.addIndex((1+i)*(k+1) + 0);  // v[i+1][0]
209            addPrimitive(triStrip);
210         }
211      }
212      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
213      {
214         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
215         {
216            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
217            for (int i = 0; i < n+1; ++i)
218            {
219               triStrip.addIndex(i * (k+1) + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
220               triStrip.addIndex(i * (k+1) + j);    // v[i][j  ]
221            }
222            addPrimitive(triStrip);
223         }
224         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
225         for (int i = 0; i < n+1; ++i)
226         {
227            triStrip.addIndex(i * (k+1) + k);  // v[i][k]
228            triStrip.addIndex(i * (k+1) + 0);  // v[i][0]
229         }
230         addPrimitive(triStrip);
231      }
232      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
233      {
234         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
235         {
236            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
237            {
238               addPrimitive(
239                  new TriangleStrip(   i *(k+1) + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
240                                    (1+i)*(k+1) + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
241                                       i *(k+1) + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
242                                    (1+i)*(k+1) + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
243            }
244            addPrimitive(
245               new TriangleStrip(   i *(k+1) + k,   // v[i  ][k]
246                                 (1+i)*(k+1) + k,   // v[i+1][k]
247                                    i *(k+1) + 0,   // v[i  ][0]
248                                 (1+i)*(k+1) + 0)); // v[i+1][0]
249         }
250      }
251   }
252
253
254
255   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
256   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
257
258   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
259
260   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
261
262   @Override
263   public Torus remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
264   {
265      return new Torus(this.r1, this.r2,
266                       n, k,
267                       type);
268   }
269}//Torus
